Twitch commands

Twitch: Chat Message

Sends a message to your Twitch chat from your default account that is connected to LioranBoard.
If you have linked more than one Twitch account to LioranBoard, you must specify the channel name, otherwise it will get sent to your default linked account's Twitch chat.
You can use emotes, whispers and mod commands (if your account has the privileges). See all possible chat commands here.

If your whisper chat command does not work, make sure your Twitch token url contains whispers:edit scope. Twitch IRC also sometimes refuses to send whispers for no reason.

Name Type Description
Message String The message to be sent over the chat.
Channel Name String Channel to send the message to. Leave blank unless you have multiple accounts connected to LB.

Twitch: Open Whispers

This command will turn on Twitch whisper alerts (they are disabled by default). All whisper alerts be received as normal chat message triggers.

Name Type Description
Open Whispers Boolean Select true to enable and false to disable whispers.

Twitch: Join Channel

This command lets you join any Twitch chat channel.
You do not need to use this command to join your own channel as long as it's linked to your LioranBoard, as it will join the chat automatically as soon as you launch Transmitter.

Name Type Description
Channel Name String Twitch channel name. Must be the login name, not display name.

Twitch: Leave Channel

This command lets you leave a Twitch chat channel you previously joined. Can be your own channel as well.

Name Type Description
Channel Name String Twitch channel name. Must be the login name, not display name.
